alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:25PM CDT until May 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL SHANNON COUNTY... At 424 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Eminence, or 15 miles northwest of Van Buren, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Ozark National Scenic Riverways... Eminence... TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
